meanings.definition: A substance with a pH greater than 7.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the alkalies in the laboratory.
meanings.sent2: Alkalies are often used in cleaning products.
meanings.sent3: The alkalies decided to throw a party and invite all the acids.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as alkalies, neutralizing the bitterness around her.
meanings.sent5: The alkalies bubbled and fizzed, transforming the solution into something new.

meanings.definition: A basic compound that neutralizes acids.
meanings.sent1: The alkalies in the antacid helped soothe his stomach.
meanings.sent2: When mixed with acids, alkalies can create a neutral solution.
meanings.sent3: The alkalies and acids had a dance-off to see who could neutralize the other first.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like alkalies, calming the heated argument.
meanings.sent5: The alkalies swooped in like heroes, saving the solution from its acidic fate.

meanings.definition: A group of chemical compounds that react with acids to form salts.
meanings.sent1: The alkalies in the test tube reacted vigorously with the acid.
meanings.sent2: Alkalies play a crucial role in the formation of salts.
meanings.sent3: The alkalies and acids formed a salty alliance against the neutral compounds.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like alkalies and acids, creating a balanced relationship.
meanings.sent5: The alkalies danced with the acids, creating a beautiful salt formation.
